body:
Again, my apologies, perhaps I'm missing something that is obvious to you.

The way I see it, functions in go return 0 or more values. If they return 1 or more values, you can return what they return from a function that returns the same number of values. If they return 0, you can't. That's inconsistent, it's a silly special case that you need to remember. I don't understand what returning void or not has to do with it.
